description: A gorgeous sunlit space houses our brand spanking new chocolate factory and cafe boutique. Eat chocolate, participate in a tasting or just come bask in the sun drinking hot chocolate with torched marshmallows. Be surrounded by the hums of the vintage chocolate machines making chocolate and the smells of cacao filling the air.

reviews.title: SOMA Chocolatemaker: Very Poor Quality Chocolate, But I Have the Best Alternative - Aline Nasseh Artisan Chocolates
text: When it comes to indulging in fine chocolates, expectations are high, and rightfully so. Unfortunately, my recent experience with SOMA Chocolatemaker left much to be desired. Despite their reputation, the quality of their chocolate fell short of expectations, leaving a bitter taste in more ways than one.

Upon unwrapping their products, I was met with a disappointing lack of richness and depth in flavor. The texture was grainy, and the overall taste seemed artificial, devoid of the nuanced complexity that defines exceptional chocolate. It was evident that SOMA Chocolatemaker had missed the mark, failing to deliver on the promise of indulgence that their branding suggests.

However, amidst the sea of dissatisfying chocolates, I stumbled upon a hidden gem: Aline Nasseh Artisan Chocolates. From the moment I visited their website at alinenasseh.com, I knew I was in for a treat.

Aline Nasseh Artisan Chocolates offers an unparalleled experience, boasting a tantalizing array of handcrafted chocolates that are as visually stunning as they are delicious. Each piece is a work of art, meticulously crafted with care and attention to detail.

reviews.title: Bad experience
text: Horrible customer service! Will never step foot in there again! They eed to know how to treat customers with respect! Chocolate way too pricey! Can find better somewhere else!

reviews.title: Horrible customer service.
text: Service was horrible and they had a bad attitude! Will never go back here. There are much better options out there.

reviews.title: Yummy chocolate !!
text: We toured the Christmas market a few weeks ago and loved Soma !! I had never heard of drinking chocolate but I’m glad I bought it ❣️We tried it over the holiday and it was wonderful 😁

reviews.title: If you are a chocolate lover stop here
text: Interesting place, a bit pricey but a nice treat. Had the hot chocolate, delicious! You can watch them make the chocolates.

reviews.title: Devine and devilish $$
text: We went for the ice cream that was good. We stayed for the mini chocolates that were Devine. A little pricey but the hazelnut, pistachio flavored confectioners were superb. Wish they had a discount for buying 6+ 12+ or more. But so many to choose from it was hard but so many were delightful. Go taste and be delighted.

reviews.title: Team Build
text: The place was amazing, all the chocolate bunnies for Easter were all so wonderful to behold. My group had to fight buying up the whole store. The staff were very friendly and it was a great highlight on our trip to the Distillery District.

reviews.title: Chocolate and ice cream/gelato
text: In winter Soma focuses on its specialty, chocolate, though cups of ice cream are available. The prices are on the high side, but the products are excellent. Before we went to the Young Centre for a performance of short plays by Pinter, we had our dessert at Soma: dark-chocolate almond clusters. Sinfully good!

reviews.title: Choc taste trip
text: We went on a ditillery tour and part of the tour involved a trip here. It was great to see the chocolate being made and even better having some samples, which were delicious.

reviews.title: I screamed
text: (Almost) about the ice cream. Or Gelato as other people would know it. About how good the ice cream here is. I would have screamed "OMG" if I wasn't absolutely focused on enjoying my ice cream and making sure I got every last little tiny piece from the pot. It is that good. And i've tried a lot of ice cream in the UK that claims to be the best.

On a hot September day, or any day,  if you are looking for a genuinely refreshing and tasty dessert, go here. There will be a queue, but it is because it is a very good place. And that queue just gives you time to consider the many flavours and potential flavour combinations you can have. I had raspberry and lemon, and would happily have gone back for each other flavour if i could
Go, go, get Gelato on the go!

reviews.title: High end serious chocolate
text: We went here 3times during a recent trip to Toronto. Truly artisanal chocolates. They do it all, from cacao beans to finished product. The truffles are fantastic. Really unusual flavors, like balsamic vinegar and Thai influences. The gelato is also really wonderful, and they had my favorite thing, Affogato (vanilla gelato with a shot of espresso). Worth the effort, definitely.

reviews.title: What a smell!
text: I'm sure breathing in must be around 300 calories, the smell is amazing. Bought some chocolate to take home, drank a couple of hot chocolates, tried the truffles, put on 30 pounds. Cool and interesting place.

reviews.title: Chocolate AND Gelato
text: We went here for the chocolates, which were delicious.  Almost as good as the ones from Belgium.  There is a nice assortment of flavors.
They also serve Gelato.  I had the pistachio and it was the best.

reviews.title: Splurge Worthy
text: Stopped in to try some sorbet on a hot and steamy day and it was absolutely delicious!! I had Ontario blueberry basil and Meyer lemon sorbet and my husband tried the Peruvian chocolate and raspberry sorbet...best sorbet we've ever had!! The rest of the store was filed with luscious chocolately treats.

reviews.title: Best Chocolate Experience Ever
text: Its a little pricey but if you're a chocolate lover you will truly appreciate this place.
2 scoops of Gelato or Sorbet will run you $5.50 The display case had around 15 varieties of Sorbet and Gelato.
Each piece of Custom made Chocolate is $2.00. You get a slight discount if you purchase a box of 5 or more pieces. The case had more than 25 varieties!
They also had a selection of coffee drinks.

reviews.title: Super good ...just expensive
text: Amazing fragrance as you get in. Super quality chocolate (tried dark chocolate with cherries and almond). Just expensive. But quality is there for sure!

reviews.title: Nice but overpriced.
text: We enjoyed our visit and our drinks (a Mayan hot chocolate and a bicerin), but I found most items expensive/overpriced, and have enjoyed lots of delicious fair trade dark chocolate from various parts of the world at more reasonable prices. (For example, their light slabs of chocolate (maybe 60-70gr) cost $7.) Best visited to buy gifts for real chocolate aficionados.

reviews.title: The chocolate heaven
text: I went there during my stay in Toronto in 2012 with my friend. It is located in the distillery district, hence we reached there in an already elated mood (side effect of a few jugs of beer).
But we realised we had reached heaven once we closed the door behind us.
Such a wonderful aroma hit our already elated senses. Really, the aroma of chocolate is divine.

we tried the spicy Mayan hot chocolate and the very aptly named " the dark side of the mug" after the famous Pink Floyd song. the Mayan elixir is perfect for the winter, it takes you to another world...much warmer and bright :)
The chocolate laboratory inside has some serious inventors going about their job in complete concentration, these guys take the chocolate stuff very seriously!!!
the whole experience was so great , that we turned up again at the Soma chocolate den next weekend with our friends to be in heaven again........
ah!!that divine aroma of chocolate keeps calling you back again :)

reviews.title: Chocolate lovers paradise
text: Artisanal chocolates and other delights make this place a must try in The Distillery District. Great selection of chocolate from various regions abd combinations.

reviews.title: Superb chocolate, gelato, and sorbets
text: This is one of our favorite places to visit before a performance at the Young Centre. Whether it's chocolate we want or a cup of gelato or sorbet, Soma is unexcelled in the area. In the winter time their spicy hot chocolate almost makes us forget the cold weather. A winner in every way!

reviews.title: Artisinal Chocolate and Gelato
text: It's tucked away in the back of the Distillery District, has a small shop, is very pricey and has a limited menu. Those negatives out of the way, you'll find great tasting Italian gelato, fun artsy hot chocolates, warm liquid chocolate 'shots' and crafty chocolate bars. One of the few highlights of the Distillery District, check it out.

reviews.title: Amazing chocolate
text: The Soma we visited was in the Distillery District and well worth a visit if you are in the area. We tried the English toffee, milk chocolate and almond and the mint chocolate. Both tasted amazing and only sorry we didn’t get more when we were there.

reviews.title: Sweet
text: Good sorbetto with interesting flavors. The chili chocolate was also interesting - thick, rich, and, well, mildly spicy. Overall, a great place to drop by for those with a sweet tooth and are feeling adventurous.

reviews.title: best gelato in Toronto
text: They prepare their own chocolate, and of course their gelato. Serve a decent coffee, and the place is enclaved in the fabulous Distillery District of Toronto. Fantastic Gelato, for a fantastic City.

reviews.title: Disappointed
text: Had read reviews about how awesome the hot chocolate is. Was really looking forward to trying it. Read the menu board and was still excited. Tasted it and was shocked at the poor taste. I've tasted better from a store bought powder mix. Really disappointed!

reviews.title: Poor Quality
text: Overall I have grown used to being disappointed by Soma. My girlfriend and I have given several chances to Soma now in hopes that it will come out good, but it really overall has not lived up to it. In general the experience starts off with poor service which leads into food which is not great followed by waiting forever for the bill. After 3 tries here I think I will probably never go back.

reviews.title: Best chocolate in Toronto for sure!
text: This is a great place. You can pick up a coffee, hot chocolate or other beverage, and shop for exquisite handmade chocolates. Of all kinds. Like... light, dark (any percentage you can imagine), on its own, or covering coffee beans, with ginger or nuts or a million other combinations. This should be on everyone's Christmas shopping stops!

reviews.title: Best Chocolate I've Tasted
text: The dark  Starry Night (chocolate with sea salt) chocolate bar is the best chocolate bar I've ever had.  My husband grabs a few for me on my birthday, Mother's Day and Valentine's Day and we stop in whenever we're in the area. I really think Soma is the best chocolate store in the city - the quality is unmatched.  They really know what they're doing.  Also try the hot chocolate and truffles.

reviews.title: As good as chocolate gets!!
text: When we found this store I was the typical child in a sweet shop (at the age of 55!). The choices seemed to be endless and original, and although I bought through the eyes the taste didn't disappoint. Absolutely beautiful.

reviews.title: Yummy Gellato and Delightfully Quirky Chocolates
text: Try the gelato for a light delicious treat.  The toasted almond is to die for.  The chocolate, is about as chocolate as it gets, and well it should since that is their main claim.

reviews.title: It's just different.
text: This is good chocolate and possibly the best hot chocolate I've had.
We ordered lactose free and it was great. I couldn't tell it wasn't milk.
Just so good!

reviews.title: Good chocolate and gifts
text: Tasty spicy hot chocolate mix was wonderful! Lots of different chocolate to explore. Very yummy! We were lucky the store was not very crowded and had excellent interactions with staff! Not to miss goodness!

reviews.title: best chocolate and gelato
text: Soma is known for the best chocolate, all kinds from sweet to spicy and   truffles. I love their chocolate. Also, they have one of the best gelato and sorbet. I love their chocolate sorbet, one of the best I had.

reviews.title: Want chocolate - go here!
text: My friend recommended we stop in here. The quality of the chocolate is so so so good! Just entering the place you are drenched in heavenly chocolate aroma! We ate a truffle from the counter and then took home some chocolate for our family. The different flavors of chocolate are vast so you can probably find something here for everyone! I went pretty plain with some salted chocolate and toffee chocolate. My mom took home similar plus some sugar free for my dad. Really good :)

reviews.title: If all you need is chocolate - come here!
text: Everything chocolate! Chocolate fixes everything! Chocolate is everything! Chocolate.. that’s it! LOL

reviews.title: Best Chocolate in Toronto
text: Known to be the best artisanal chocolate in Toronto which we put to a test. Brought back a variety of chocolates from Belgium and blind tested with Soma’s and hands down - Soma came out the winner! Hot coco with chilli is a must try!

reviews.title: Delicious chocolate! worth every penny
text: If you love chocolate this is quite literally heaven on earth. Excellent selection of just about any chocolate item you can conjure up. There is a very long line for the drinks, but you can skip that line, go inside and there is a register in the right corner you can purchase your goodies 'to go'.

reviews.title: Amazing spiced Mayan drink
text: This is a must stop in the distillery district. They have amazing gelato and chocolate products. However, the must have is the Mayan spiced hit chocolate. A real treat!

reviews.title: Exceptional chocolate
text: Distillery district location makes chocolate on site. Smell is absolutely divine. Prices are reasonable that it is handmade chocolates.  Flavour and quality are top notch. Always a highlight to visiting the distillery district!

reviews.title: Rustic botique chocolate shop
text: There are two Soma locations in Toronto - this one in the Distillery District and one on King Street near Second City. I know because I dragged my husband to both after I fell in love with this chocolate shop. The one on King Street is larger and has more offerings but they are both delightful. If you enjoy high quality house-made chocolate and don't mind a premium price this is a great place to visit. If only they shipped to the US . .
